bibl.title: Letter from Raul de Cardenas to Philip Showalter Hench, June 23, 1948

div1.p: Cardenas informs Hench that he and others visited the public works department, and that they believe the work to preserve Camp Lazear will begin soon. It will not be necessary to accept Hench's offer of $1000 for immediate preservation efforts on Building No. 1.

div1.head: Letter from Raul de Cardenas to Philip Showalter Hench, June 23, 1948
div1.opener:
VICEPRESIDENTE DE LA REPUBLICA
PARTICULAR
Havana, Cuba, June 23, 1948
Philip S. Hench, M.D.,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn., U. S. A.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I duly received your letter dated
the 5th of May. Due to the Elections who took place
on the 1st. of this month, we were all so busy and
therefore I did not answer you before.

Two days ago we had a meeting in
the Department of Public Works, being present: Se-
nator Dr. Andreu, Engineer Honorato Colete, Dr. Fe-
lipe Carbonell and self and we agreed there to pro-
ceed in taking steps towards the collection of the
necessary amount, from the National Treasury, to
make the works of preservation of the “Caseta” in
which the experimental proofs of Dr. Finlay's theo-
ry were made.

I believe that these steps will be
successful in the near future and in that case it
would not be necessary to accept your kind offer in
paying for the erection of a galvanized-iron cover to
protect the “Caseta”.

Anyway, we are very grateful to the
Mayo Clinic and to you for this offering.

I shall keep you very well informed
on any further developments of this matter.
